author: Andrew Jones
comment: Just what I was looking for - a basic sms app for my watch with customisable message templates. 4 stars for that. If there was a way to select favourite contacts and have them stay at the top of the contact s list, I would award it 5 stars. The keyboard input is a bit limited as it's restricted to phone key layout only and there's no predictive text, but I probably won't use that anyway.

author: Cathryn Makurat
comment: I like the ui, looks clean. Recipients never received my messages.

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Doesn't work.

author: Steet Preacher
comment: Better and faster then stock...how do I use T9 mode??? Need to add ability to adjust font size...

author: Ron Rieckenberg
comment: I wish I could input a phone number instead of having to create a contact first before sending an sms

author: Chris Gtts
comment: When it works, it's really good. Unfortunately it often crashes whilst loading and makes it longer to load than getting your phone out of your pocket.
title: Nice idea but fails too often

author: Carlos Alexney Herrera
comment: Does not load long conversations at all! Other than that works great
title: Does not load long conversations

author: Eric Love
comment: Wish you would add a spot where we could set a custom signature for messages.  If you could add that 5 stars
title: Pretty Good

author: Manuel Passadouro
comment: Only missing contact photos for 5 stars.
title: A worthy successor to the coffee app

comment: Very Kool app, works like a CHAMP !!!

author: Hadi Sd
comment: perfection

author: Mike Hillyard
comment: Just got this as keyboard for wear but dissapointed not to see predictive text option, can this be added please to increase stars. Cheers.
title: Looks good!

author: dariush abdolahi
comment: Need to show contact picture and a search box for contact

author: Chua M T
comment: Please fix the screen to scroll up when new auto reply are inserted. Can't see what its type cos keyboard blocking it
title: Nice App BUT

author: Keith Spencer
comment: So far so good, does as much as I'd hope, though 5 stars if t9 predictive text is added as well as a way to filter contacts or add favorites. Keep up the good work!
title: Best I've found so far

author: sara tijerina
comment: When receiving incoming texts, the watch vibrates but screen doesn't light up. Am I doing something wrong?
title: Screen won't light up on Moto 360

author: Jacob Voshage
comment: Keyboard is not difficult to type on

author: Chima Alozie
comment: I must say, I really like this app. Already deleted some others when I found this. One little problem I have is: I can select a contact and type text on the keyboard, but why can't I reply to incoming messages using the keyboard? Or am I missing something? Great app nonetheless! [Update] No i was wrong! Touching open gives me the keyboard and all other option. (One more star added). The 6th star will come when predictive text is incorporated.
title: Very Good!

author: Kevin Nenkov
comment: When the app launches on my Moto 360 correctly and actually displays messages and works as it should, it's a fantastic little app. However, 80% of the time when I launch the app on my watch, it crashes and doesn't show anything, only the little loading spin symbol. Please fix this, because this app is very useful and I do love using it when it does launch correctly.
title: Not launching correctly

author: Samuel Gaspard
comment: This is a good app, it would benefit from predictive T9 texting. I had difficulty with finding different punctuation marks and reliable use of the shift button, but that may be due to the size of my watch. Moto 360 2nd gen. Predictive text and a little more intuitive use of the menus and it is 5 stars.
title: Good app, but...

author: Luke Swearingen
comment: I really enjoy it, its better than anything out there. The only complaint I have is the lack of predictive texting. Once that comes around, I think this will be one of the best wear apps. I'd pay for predictive texting

reply.author: Exaud, Lda
reply.content: Thank you! We're considering this feature for our current development roadmap.

title: Good, could be great

author: Devin Spell
comment: I love the T9 keyboard, but the app isn't perfect. I would love to turn the sms notification off since my sms app already notifies me. Also there is alot of punctuations missing. Lastly is alot of the times, clicking on a conversation has a long wait screen where sometimes the conversation refuses to load.

reply.author: Exaud, Lda
reply.content: Thanks for the review and suggestions! We'll be adding missing punctuation symbols, considering the notification control feature. As for the long syncing time, that depends on Bluetooth connection quality and environment mainly, e.g how close is the phone. We'd suggest to check is there any correlation.

title: Great, but not perfect

author: clive rennison
comment: So far this has been working flawlessly! I have tried wear messenger, messenger for wear, coffee and pretty much every other messaging app and this is the one I really like. Just need predictive text as an option. Great job Dev also can we have emoji access on keyboard please
title: Great

author: Yap Hock Heng
comment: Can't grant permission on LG g4 and see the app on Sony sw3
title: Doesn't work with marshmallow?

author: Brittany Matthews
comment: I would recommend maybe adding different keyboards and suggestive text/predictive texts. And when you're in a group text, on the watch in the group text maybe make it so I can tell who sent what. Good app though!
title: Good app!

author: Ross Shepherd
comment: great app, i like it, still don't know how to put a space in-between words, is it possible? if so it gets 5/5

reply.author: Exaud, Lda
reply.content: It is! Just use the middle button on the bottom row, between the shift arrow and OK check mark.

author: Mark Mooney
comment: Would be perfect only if you could fix it for when you receive a message the keyboard would come up for a reply to let you type instead of the stock messages !
title: Ok so far

author: Tim Kearney
comment: Looks good and kinda works good.... Doesn't dismiss the notification on watch after replying and doesn't clear notifications on the phone so I get double notifications on the watch (using chompsms and textra)
title: Alright

author: Hossein IsHere
comment: Works nice,  just as my phone is dual sim, it will send sms from second sim, didn't expect that. At least it could use first or default sim!
title: Missing some features

author: Clint Lawler
comment: I wanted a full keyboard originally but T9 is better. Needs a setting to stop vibration while typing on watch.
title: Simple. Easy.

author: Vannica Svay
comment: Very slick and looks like it was meant to be built into a smart watch. Only wished there were emojis too. Please emojis!!!!
title: Great design

author: Ahmed Ghaith
comment: It is a perfect app .. Except there is no whatsapp notification or reply back keyboard .. Please add whatsapp urgently
title: Where is whatsapp :(

author: Tookie Snelmurf
comment: Technical < ethical.  Suck it.
title: Oh hell no.

author: S.Morteza Hosseini
comment: Likeeeeeeee

author: Naz Aku
comment: Best app for typing so far for android wear for circular faces. If possible would be good to have a slightly smaller delete button, full screen fit when typing on a circular watch, ability to swipe away when typing a double L for example so that not waiting for timeout, and better fit on circular screens (top and bottom tiny bit cut off when reading sms). However best interface yet for typing so far well done keep it up

reply.author: Exaud, Lda
reply.content: Thank you for the review and feedback!  We're considering these features.

title: Great app

author: Vlad Buda
comment: Finally a usable keyboard for entering SMS text!
title: Best SMS text entering app for Android Wear!

author: CIDTV
comment: No true XT9 input?

reply.author: Exaud, Lda
reply.content: Not yet, we may consider adding predictive word suggestion and typing correction in a future release but fitting corresponding UI elements on a small screen of a typical watch without affecting usability is not trivial.

author: Breez Matic
comment: To open the app on a android wear device its very slow 🐌. .which sucks because so far the app is pretty cool and very easy to use
title: Nice app! But its slow

author: Tyler Argyle
comment: I'm pretty sure I've researched and tried nearly every other android wear messaging app + keyboard and this one really is the best, but I beg you, add predictive text and this app will be unstoppable!!
title: Keyboard doesn't suck!

author: M Lady08
comment: It's one of the best ones m, but would stop syncing every few days and wouldn't always load msgs in thread. Otherwise it really is one of the better ones out there. Love the keyboard too.

reply.author: Exaud, Lda
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Syncing issues are mainly caused by Bluetooth connectivity issues in our understanding, our development team is currently working to improve that area as much as we can.

title: So much potential.
